_prev_prog_3.TR_OtherType: Computer based training for new employees

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Organic Technologies RMP Executive Summary:
 
1) Your Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled
Organic Technologies is a producer of GMP Nutraceuticals, Food Ingredients, Pharmaceutical Intermediates, Flavors, Food Additives, Specialty Gases and Fine Chemicals. We are committed to being the best performing Batch/Toll Manufacturer in all aspects of our business, including safety, health and environmental affairs. As a dynamic, fully capable custom processor, we apply our expertise in taking products from the research stage through process design and plant construction to finished goods.  Internally Organic Technologies uses a combination of extensive engineering standards, design, safety work processes, coupled with operational and personnel safety programs to ensure the safe operation of all of our facilities. 

The following chemicals that will be used here at Organic Technologies are regulated by the EPA's Risk Management Program rule, in excess of their threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds:

CD-106 System Chemicals
1)   1,3-Pentadiene
2)   1-Butene
3)   2,2-Dimethylpropane
4)   2-Butene
5)   2-Butene-cis
6)   2-Butene-trans
7)   Ethyl Acetylene
8)   Isobutane
9)   Isopentane
10) 1,2-Propadiene
11) Propane
12) Propylene
13) Propyne

All of the above chemicals are distilled in the same process called the CD-106 distillation system. 

Worst case and alternative worst-case scenarios were developed for each substance and it was determined that Isopentane will generate the greatest off-site impact for ther worst case scenario.  Propyne will generate the greatest impact for the alternative worst case scenario.

Organic Technologies receives one of the above chemicals or mixtures by tank truck, stores it in a 13,000-gallon tank, and processes it in the CD-106 distillation system.  The material is transferred into containers (cylinders) or tank trucks for distribution to the customer. Finished products from the CD-106 System are shipped from

the Coshocton facility by truck.  CD-106 System chemicals are listed as a regulated flammable substance in EPA's Risk Management Program rule, with a threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.  The CD-106 system storage, distillation and transfer process at Organic Technologies contains about 100,000 pounds of chemicals.

2) The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility:
In accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management standard and EPA's Risk Management Program rule, the Coshocton facility has a comprehensive accident prevention program in place to ensure the safety of our employees, our neighbors and the community around us.  On a local level, this prevention program is built around process safety concepts such as:

* Documented process safety information to ensure the process design is understood and maintained throughout its life;
* Process hazard analysis to identify and control all of the hazards associated with handling flammable substances;
* Processes are designed and engineered with process specific safety controls;
* Trained operators, using written operating procedures, to safely operate the process as intended; and work with Delta V automated process control system
* Maintenance programs and procedures to ensure the on-going mechanical integrity of the process.

The prevention program is audited periodically, to ensure that the process safety concepts and practices are in place and working effectively.

3) The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:
We maintain a number of programs to help prevent accidental releases and ensure safe operation. The accident prevention programs in place are in compliance with the OSHA's Process Safety Management  (PSM) rule and the EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) rule. All systems here at Organic Technologies have been designed for safety. This includes a process technology system covering the hazards of materials, equipment

design basis and process design basis. This incorporates extensive safety instrumentation such as temperature indication, pressure indication, level transmitters, high-level safeties, % LEL gas detectors, coupled with the Delta V Process Control System providing alarms and interlocks. The facility is maintained by identifying all process safety critical equipment and performing routine inspections to ensure proper operation and mechanical integrity. A work order management system is used to control maintenance on the systems. All maintenance employees are trained in preventive maintenance and operations employees are trained to properly follow approved procedures. The individual elements of our prevention program work together to prevent accidental chemical releases. The CD-106 distillation system was built following NFPA 58 design and ASME Pressure Piping Code and installation guidelines. Organic Technologies has an active Accident/Incident Investigation program and initiates investigations within 48 hours. In concert with the Coshocton Fire Department and the Emergency Management Director   a NFPA Fire Safety Analysis was conducted.   Organic Technologies has two professional engineers on staff.


4) The Five-Year Accident History:
There have been no reportable accidents at Organic Technologies in the last 5 years.

5) The Emergency Response Program:
In the event of an emergency, Organic Technologies has an emergency action plan in place, which contains procedures for employees to follow, including notification of local response agencies.  All facility employees are trained in their role in the emergency action plan, and Organic Technologies policy requires that emergency drills be conducted at least annually. Organic Technologies employees will not respond to an emergency involving the CD-106 System. In the event of an emergency release from the CD-106 Distillation System with a possible offsite consequence, the city of Coshocton Fire Department will be n

otified by calling 911. The Coshocton Fire Department has been informed of the storage of CD-106 System materials and the Coshocton Fire Department conducts an annual site walkthrough of the system. The CD-106 system has it's own emergency shutdown devices located in three key areas. Part of the shutdown procedure involves disconnecting the electrical supply to the facility, shutting the facility natural gas supply and performing the CD-106 Distillation System emergency shutdown.

6) Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
Organic Technologies is committed to the continual improvement of its safety, health and environmental programs. Below are some of the major steps we will be considering to improve safety at our facility over the coming year.  


Planned Changes:
1)  Continue to review and update process specific training programs
2)  Provide traffic barrier 
3)
